title: Semi-supervised Federated Learning Process for Personal Information Protection and Transportation Mode Identification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and experience in using smart devices
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative professionals who acquire foundational competencies to contribute to urban traffic solutions through transportation identification technology. Focus is on applying AI technology that ensures personal data privacy.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic principles of semi-supervised learning and federated learning.
Learners can design a model to classify transportation mode data in an environment where personal information is protected.
Learners can implement a transportation mode identification model with over 85% accuracy using real sensor data.
Learners can propose strategies to improve data labeling efficiency in a collaborative learning environment through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
